dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1143 IH: Prohibiting Federal Emergencies for Abortion Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Pfluger (for himself, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Mr. Alford, and Mr. Steube) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To prohibit the declaration of a Federal emergency relating to abortion.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Prohibiting Federal Emergencies for Abortion Act.

section.header: Prohibition on declaration of Federal emergency relating to abortion

subsection.header: Prohibition on declarations of national emergencies relating to abortion under National Emergencies Act
subsection.text: Section 201 of the National Emergencies Act (50 U.S.C. 1621) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on declaring national emergences relating to abortion

paragraph.text: The President may not declare a national emergency under subsection (a) for purposes of—

subparagraph.text: promoting, supporting, or expanding access to abortion; or
taking adverse action against or litigating against States that prohibit or otherwise restrict abortion.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term abortion means the use or prescription of any instrument, medicine, drug, or other substance or device to intentionally—

subparagraph.text: kill the unborn child of a woman known to be pregnant; or
prematurely terminate the pregnancy of a woman known to be pregnant, with an intention other than to—

clause.text: increase the probability of a live birth or of preserving the life or health of the child after live birth; or

subsection.text: Section 319 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 247d) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding this section, the Secretary may not declare a public health emergency under this section for the purpose of—

subparagraph.text: promoting, supporting, or expanding access to abortion; or
taking adverse action against or litigating against States that prohibit or otherwise restrict abortion.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term abortion means the use or prescription of any instrument, medicine, drug, or other substance or device to intentionally—

subparagraph.text: kill the unborn child of a woman known to be pregnant; or
prematurely terminate the pregnancy of a woman known to be pregnant, with an intention other than to—

clause.text: increase the probability of a live birth or of preserving the life or health of the child after live birth; or

subsection.header: Emergency declarations under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act
subsection.text: Section 501 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5191) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on declarations relating to abortion

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term abortion means the use or prescription of any instrument, medicine, drug, or other substance or device to intentionally—

subparagraph.text: kill the unborn child of a woman known to be pregnant; or
prematurely terminate the pregnancy of a woman known to be pregnant, with an intention other than to—

clause.text: increase the probability of a live birth or of preserving the life or health of the child after live birth; or

paragraph.text: The President may not declare that an emergency exists under subsection (a) for the purpose of—

subparagraph.text: promoting, supporting, or expanding access to abortion; or
taking adverse action against or litigating against States that prohibit or otherwise restrict abortion.
